speaker: KING HENRY V
text_entry: SCENE II. The same.

speaker: KING HENRY V
text_entry: Enter NYM, BARDOLPH, PISTOL, and Boy

speaker: BARDOLPH
text_entry: On, on, on, on, on! to the breach, to the breach!

speaker: NYM
text_entry: Pray thee, corporal, stay: the knocks are too hot;

speaker: NYM
text_entry: and, for mine own part, I have not a case of lives:

speaker: NYM
text_entry: the humour of it is too hot, that is the very

speaker: NYM
text_entry: plain-song of it.

speaker: PISTOL
text_entry: The plain-song is most just: for humours do abound:

speaker: PISTOL
text_entry: Knocks go and come; God's vassals drop and die;

speaker: PISTOL
text_entry: And sword and shield,

speaker: PISTOL
text_entry: In bloody field,

speaker: PISTOL
text_entry: Doth win immortal fame.

speaker: Boy
text_entry: Would I were in an alehouse in London! I would give

speaker: Boy
text_entry: all my fame for a pot of ale and safety.

speaker: PISTOL
text_entry: And I:

speaker: PISTOL
text_entry: If wishes would prevail with me,

speaker: PISTOL
text_entry: My purpose should not fail with me,

speaker: PISTOL
text_entry: But thither would I hie.

speaker: Boy
text_entry: As duly, but not as truly,

speaker: Boy
text_entry: As bird doth sing on bough.

speaker: Boy
text_entry: Enter FLUELLEN

speaker: FLUELLEN
text_entry: Up to the breach, you dogs! avaunt, you cullions!

speaker: FLUELLEN
text_entry: Driving them forward

speaker: PISTOL
text_entry: Be merciful, great duke, to men of mould.

speaker: PISTOL
text_entry: Abate thy rage, abate thy manly rage,

speaker: PISTOL
text_entry: Abate thy rage, great duke!

speaker: PISTOL
text_entry: Good bawcock, bate thy rage; use lenity, sweet chuck!

speaker: NYM
text_entry: These be good humours! your honour wins bad humours.

speaker: NYM
text_entry: Exeunt all but Boy

speaker: Boy
text_entry: As young as I am, I have observed these three

speaker: Boy
text_entry: swashers. I am boy to them all three: but all they

speaker: Boy
text_entry: three, though they would serve me, could not be man

speaker: Boy
text_entry: to me; for indeed three such antics do not amount to

speaker: Boy
text_entry: a man. For Bardolph, he is white-livered and

speaker: Boy
text_entry: red-faced; by the means whereof a' faces it out, but

speaker: Boy
text_entry: fights not. For Pistol, he hath a killing tongue

speaker: Boy
text_entry: and a quiet sword; by the means whereof a' breaks

speaker: Boy
text_entry: words, and keeps whole weapons. For Nym, he hath

speaker: Boy
text_entry: heard that men of few words are the best men; and

speaker: Boy
text_entry: therefore he scorns to say his prayers, lest a'

speaker: Boy
text_entry: should be thought a coward: but his few bad words

speaker: Boy
text_entry: are matched with as few good deeds; for a' never

speaker: Boy
text_entry: broke any man's head but his own, and that was

speaker: Boy
text_entry: against a post when he was drunk. They will steal

speaker: Boy
text_entry: any thing, and call it purchase. Bardolph stole a

speaker: Boy
text_entry: lute-case, bore it twelve leagues, and sold it for

speaker: Boy
text_entry: three half pence. Nym and Bardolph are sworn

speaker: Boy
text_entry: brothers in filching, and in Calais they stole a

speaker: Boy
text_entry: fire-shovel: I knew by that piece of service the

speaker: Boy
text_entry: men would carry coals. They would have me as

speaker: Boy
text_entry: familiar with men's pockets as their gloves or their

speaker: Boy
text_entry: handkerchers: which makes much against my manhood,

speaker: Boy
text_entry: if I should take from another's pocket to put into

speaker: Boy
text_entry: mine; for it is plain pocketing up of wrongs. I

speaker: Boy
text_entry: must leave them, and seek some better service:

speaker: Boy
text_entry: their villany goes against my weak stomach, and

speaker: Boy
text_entry: therefore I must cast it up.

speaker: Boy
text_entry: Exit

speaker: Boy
text_entry: Re-enter FLUELLEN, GOWER following

speaker: GOWER
text_entry: Captain Fluellen, you must come presently to the

speaker: GOWER
text_entry: mines; the Duke of Gloucester would speak with you.

speaker: FLUELLEN
text_entry: To the mines! tell you the duke, it is not so good

speaker: FLUELLEN
text_entry: to come to the mines; for, look you, the mines is

speaker: FLUELLEN
text_entry: not according to the disciplines of the war: the

speaker: FLUELLEN
text_entry: concavities of it is not sufficient; for, look you,

speaker: FLUELLEN
text_entry: the athversary, you may discuss unto the duke, look

speaker: FLUELLEN
text_entry: you, is digt himself four yard under the

speaker: FLUELLEN
text_entry: countermines: by Cheshu, I think a' will plough up

speaker: FLUELLEN
text_entry: all, if there is not better directions.

speaker: GOWER
text_entry: The Duke of Gloucester, to whom the order of the

speaker: GOWER
text_entry: siege is given, is altogether directed by an

speaker: GOWER
text_entry: Irishman, a very valiant gentleman, i' faith.

speaker: FLUELLEN
text_entry: It is Captain Macmorris, is it not?

speaker: GOWER
text_entry: I think it be.

speaker: FLUELLEN
text_entry: By Cheshu, he is an ass, as in the world: I will

speaker: FLUELLEN
text_entry: verify as much in his beard: be has no more

speaker: FLUELLEN
text_entry: directions in the true disciplines of the wars, look

speaker: FLUELLEN
text_entry: you, of the Roman disciplines, than is a puppy-dog.

speaker: FLUELLEN
text_entry: Enter MACMORRIS and Captain JAMY

speaker: GOWER
text_entry: Here a' comes; and the Scots captain, Captain Jamy, with him.

speaker: FLUELLEN
text_entry: Captain Jamy is a marvellous falourous gentleman,

speaker: FLUELLEN
text_entry: that is certain; and of great expedition and

speaker: FLUELLEN
text_entry: knowledge in th' aunchient wars, upon my particular

speaker: FLUELLEN
text_entry: knowledge of his directions: by Cheshu, he will

speaker: FLUELLEN
text_entry: maintain his argument as well as any military man in

speaker: FLUELLEN
text_entry: the world, in the disciplines of the pristine wars

speaker: FLUELLEN
text_entry: of the Romans.

speaker: JAMY
text_entry: I say gud-day, Captain Fluellen.

speaker: FLUELLEN
text_entry: God-den to your worship, good Captain James.

speaker: GOWER
text_entry: How now, Captain Macmorris! have you quit the

speaker: GOWER
text_entry: mines? have the pioneers given o'er?

speaker: MACMORRIS
text_entry: By Chrish, la! tish ill done: the work ish give

speaker: MACMORRIS
text_entry: over, the trompet sound the retreat. By my hand, I

speaker: MACMORRIS
text_entry: swear, and my father's soul, the work ish ill done;

speaker: MACMORRIS
text_entry: it ish give over: I would have blowed up the town, so

speaker: MACMORRIS
text_entry: Chrish save me, la! in an hour: O, tish ill done,

speaker: MACMORRIS
text_entry: tish ill done; by my hand, tish ill done!

speaker: FLUELLEN
text_entry: Captain Macmorris, I beseech you now, will you

speaker: FLUELLEN
text_entry: voutsafe me, look you, a few disputations with you,

speaker: FLUELLEN
text_entry: as partly touching or concerning the disciplines of

speaker: FLUELLEN
text_entry: the war, the Roman wars, in the way of argument,

speaker: FLUELLEN
text_entry: look you, and friendly communication; partly to

speaker: FLUELLEN
text_entry: satisfy my opinion, and partly for the satisfaction,

speaker: FLUELLEN
text_entry: look you, of my mind, as touching the direction of

speaker: FLUELLEN
text_entry: the military discipline; that is the point.

speaker: JAMY
text_entry: It sall be vary gud, gud feith, gud captains bath:

speaker: JAMY
text_entry: and I sall quit you with gud leve, as I may pick

speaker: JAMY
text_entry: occasion; that sall I, marry.

speaker: MACMORRIS
text_entry: It is no time to discourse, so Chrish save me: the

speaker: MACMORRIS
text_entry: day is hot, and the weather, and the wars, and the

speaker: MACMORRIS
text_entry: king, and the dukes: it is no time to discourse. The

speaker: MACMORRIS
text_entry: town is beseeched, and the trumpet call us to the

speaker: MACMORRIS
text_entry: breach; and we talk, and, be Chrish, do nothing:

speaker: MACMORRIS
text_entry: 'tis shame for us all: so God sa' me, 'tis shame to

speaker: MACMORRIS
text_entry: stand still; it is shame, by my hand: and there is

speaker: MACMORRIS
text_entry: throats to be cut, and works to be done; and there

speaker: MACMORRIS
text_entry: ish nothing done, so Chrish sa' me, la!

speaker: JAMY
text_entry: By the mess, ere theise eyes of mine take themselves

speaker: JAMY
text_entry: to slomber, ay'll de gud service, or ay'll lig i'

speaker: JAMY
text_entry: the grund for it; ay, or go to death; and ay'll pay

speaker: JAMY
text_entry: 't as valourously as I may, that sall I suerly do,

speaker: JAMY
text_entry: that is the breff and the long. Marry, I wad full

speaker: JAMY
text_entry: fain hear some question 'tween you tway.

speaker: FLUELLEN
text_entry: Captain Macmorris, I think, look you, under your

speaker: FLUELLEN
text_entry: correction, there is not many of your nation--

speaker: MACMORRIS
text_entry: Of my nation! What ish my nation? Ish a villain,

speaker: MACMORRIS
text_entry: and a bastard, and a knave, and a rascal. What ish

speaker: MACMORRIS
text_entry: my nation? Who talks of my nation?

speaker: FLUELLEN
text_entry: Look you, if you take the matter otherwise than is

speaker: FLUELLEN
text_entry: meant, Captain Macmorris, peradventure I shall think

speaker: FLUELLEN
text_entry: you do not use me with that affability as in

speaker: FLUELLEN
text_entry: discretion you ought to use me, look you: being as

speaker: FLUELLEN
text_entry: good a man as yourself, both in the disciplines of

speaker: FLUELLEN
text_entry: war, and in the derivation of my birth, and in

speaker: FLUELLEN
text_entry: other particularities.

speaker: MACMORRIS
text_entry: I do not know you so good a man as myself: so

speaker: MACMORRIS
text_entry: Chrish save me, I will cut off your head.

speaker: GOWER
text_entry: Gentlemen both, you will mistake each other.

speaker: JAMY
text_entry: A! that's a foul fault.

speaker: JAMY
text_entry: A parley sounded

speaker: GOWER
text_entry: The town sounds a parley.

speaker: FLUELLEN
text_entry: Captain Macmorris, when there is more better

speaker: FLUELLEN
text_entry: opportunity to be required, look you, I will be so

speaker: FLUELLEN
text_entry: bold as to tell you I know the disciplines of war;

speaker: FLUELLEN
text_entry: and there is an end.

speaker: FLUELLEN
text_entry: Exeunt
